sentences: Hän mittaa tarkasti aineiden määrän laboratoriossa.
context: The Finnish verb 'mitata' means 'to measure'. It is a transitive verb, meaning it requires an object. The dictionary definition shows various conjugations of the verb in different tenses and moods.  It can also mean to take someone’s temperature ('kuume' refers to fever). The '-ta' ending indicates the infinitive form of the verb.
